examples: he was sorry he had to sever his ties with other members of the team

results.definition: a fastener that serves to join or connect
finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.
one of the cross braces that support the rails on a railway track
examples: the British call a railroad tie a sleeper

results.definition: a horizontal beam used to prevent two other structural members from spreading apart or separating
examples: he nailed the rafters together with a tie beam

results.definition: fasten or secure with a rope, string, or cord
examples: They tied their victim to the chair

results.definition: the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided
examples: their record was 3 wins, 6 losses and a tie

results.definition: connect, fasten, or put together two or more pieces
neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn (mostly by men) under a collar and tied in knot at the front
examples: he stood in front of the mirror tightening his necktie
he wore a vest and tie

results.definition: a cord (or string or ribbon or wire etc.) with which something is tied
examples: he needed a tie for the packages

results.definition: equality of score in a contest
form a knot or bow in

examples: These big jets are tied to large airports

results.definition: (music) a slur over two notes of the same pitch; indicates that the note is to be sustained for their combined time value
unite musical notes by a tie
